results.title: A Word to the wise
results.brief_description: Carelessness with an electric iron, a cigarette, or a radiator can start a fire in your home, or in your next door neighbour’s home. This film demonstrates how to take precautions against such common domestic fire hazards and provides statistical information on just how easily fires can start. Entertaining and informative narration.

results.title: A Wonderful construction
results.brief_description: Discusses the lack of job satisfaction on construction sites in America since the depression. Through commentary and interview, compares this with the ideal city as envisaged by the French artist, Fernand Leger in his painting “Les Constructeurs”. Written and photographed by Don Lenzer. Music by Erik Satie and Frank Zappa.

results.title: A Woman of the outback
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Robyn Ingram lives and works with her husband and two small children on an isolated sheep station 200km. from the nearest town, Wentworth in N.S.W. The program observes Robyn at work on the farm, as teacher to her small children and on brief visits to friends on a neighbouring farm and in the city, and speculates on the pluses and minuses of such an isolated life. Introduced by Franca Arena.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: A Woman of Sri Lanka
results.creator_credit: Sisira Suraweera, Gian Manara, SLRC Sri Lanka, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Udayani is a young Sri Lankan wife and mother who lives in a village near Kandy. She lives a simple traditional life rooted in Buddhist beliefs and customs. She is shown at work in the fields and at home, visiting the Temple of the Tooth in Kandy at the time of an important festival and assisting in the preparations for her younger sister’s marriage. The program is introduced by Franca Arena.

results.title: A Woman's story
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, Greenpark Productions and Joe Mendoza
results.brief_description: Through the story of one woman, the film gives an account of the work done by thousands of women in Britain who devote part of their spare time to various voluntary social services. The film is also significant in its exploration of the precursor of what would become the Department of Family and Community Services, staffed not by philanthropic local volunteers but by professional social workers.

results.title: A Woman's place is...
results.creator_credit: Edward Magruder Jones, Elspeth MacDougall and United Nations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Womanpower”.
This film was made during the International Women’s Year, 1975 and focuses on Sweden as an example of committed government using the full range of tools at its disposal in a real attempt to give substance to equality for women as set down in the United Nations Charter. Discusses women’s role in the workforce, sexism in the advertising world, men’s role in parenting and sharing house duties, educating primary aged children about gender roles and stereotyping, and basically highlighting the need for equality in all areas of life. Narrated by Joyce Gordon.

results.title: A Woman's place is in the house
results.creator_credit: Nancy W Porter, WGBH (Boston) and Mickey Lemle
results.brief_description: Made in 1976, this film is a profile of Elaine Noble, who was Massachusetts’ State Representative and who is a homosexual. Elaine Noble talks about her openness towards her homosexuality and she comments on the effects of this on her personal and professional life. She also discusses the variety of issues that she must deal with in her electoral district.

results.title: A woman's place
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough, Stafford Garner, Australia-Japan Foundation and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into Japan”.
Examines how geishas are trained in song, dance, and sophisticated conversation, and how they still reign supreme as Japan’s most prestigious entertainers, as compared to women who work in clubs and bars. Geishas are employed for important functions. The program also takes a very general look at the state of women in Japan today.

results.title: A Window to trade
results.creator_credit: Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and Susan Cornwell
results.brief_description: Shows the role of the International Trade Development Centres in advising and guiding business about the marketing of overseas products to Australia. Seminars are regularly conducted in all cities. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.
